Perhaps  the  most  visible  example  of  joint  Nuu-chah-nulth and non-Aboriginal activism was the protest held on 20 October  1984,  outside  the  provincial  legislature  in  Victoria,  British  Col-umbia’s capital, where the 23-foot-high welcome figure Haa-hoo-ilth-quin(“Cedar Man”) carving by Nuu-chah-nulth artist Joe David, was on display (Clapperton, 2019).

“Traditional” villages recreated for benefit of tourists to the region.  In reality, indigenous communities now face challenges of extreme poverty because their main form of subsistence, pastoral herding, has been greatly hindered by touristic developments.  (Image by Minority Rights Group International)

Lake Bogoria is of great cultural and religious significance to the Endorois.  Lake Bogoria is the spiritual home of all Endorois, living and dead, and it is where their ancestors’ burial grounds exist.  This area is now one of the largest hotspots for tourism in the area and many visitors come to witness the geysers.  (Image by Minority Rights Group International)

In the past 30 years, the Endorois community has slowly and methodically been evicted from their traditional lands.  A landmark ruling by the African Commission on Human and Peoples’ Rights has deemed such forced eviction to be unlawful.  Wilson Kipsang Kipkazi, of the Endorois Welfare Council (EWC) said in a recent interview, “We are delighted that the African Commission has recognized the wrong that was done decades ago.  This decision is the result of a sustained campaign for the recognition of the Endorois as a distinct indigenous community and the restoration of our ancestral land.”  (Image by Minority Rights Group International)

description: Leonila Pesadilla, who was killed with her husband Ramon inside their home in Compostela Valley, is among the slain farmers given tribute by the Kilusang Magbubukid ng Pilipinas (Peasant Movement of the Philippines). Ilang-Ilang Quijano

A Karapatan poster of peasant couple Ramon and Leonila Pesadilla, members of the Compostela Valley Farmers Association, who were murdered March 2 by gunmen who barged into their home in Barangay Osmena, Compostela town, Compostela Valley. The two were active in opposinng the encroachment of large-scale mining. Before they were killed, they had donated a parcel of land for the Salugpungan Ta Tanu IgkanugonÂ Community Learning Center, a school for lumad children.

name: Protests of local activists in Warsaw
description:
'Specustawa węglowa' means the project of changes in the ‘Geological and Mining Law’. This amendment would have ruled that new mines be opened by virtue of a decision of the Minister of Environment on the base of the list of natural resources deposits with ‘fundamental importance for the national economy’, prepared by the national government. In the end, after protests, MPs decided not to implement changes into existing law._x000D_
The banner in the picture says: 'Specustawa węglowa means destroyed houses'.

Pescadores Artesanales de Coishco se oponen a proyecto de maricultura [1]
Un negocio rentable en la profundidad del mar
description:
La concha de abanico ocupa el tercer lugar en la producción peruana, sumando US$ 28,8 millones (-34.68%)._x000D_
(Acuapesca, 2015)

name: Criadores de concha abanico denuncian que no les dejan trabajar
description:
Muy preocupados se encuentran los maricultores del puerto de Coishco, pues un grupo de pescadores artesanales se estarían oponiendo a su crianza de conchas de abanicos. El asunto ya salido de control, pues quienes serían los afectados aseguran haber recibido amenazas por parte de este grupo de pescadores que se oponen a su actividad._x000D_
Por su parte, el presidente de la asociación de pescadores artesanales de Coishco, contó que a él directamente le han pedido que se desembarquen de la zona en la que trabajan._x000D_
Como se recuerda, la asociación de pescadores de Coishco solicita la concesión de 47 hectáreas, a 200 metros de la Isla Santa, para la instalación de un criadero de conchas de abanico pero hay un grupo de pescadores que se oponen a esta concesión._x000D_
(CanalReal, 2014)

name: A Sri Lankan Buddhist monk and others argue with a police officer
Sri Lankan villagers shout slogans during a protest in Mirijjawila village in Ambalantota, Sri Lanka
A Sri Lankan Buddhist monk and villagers argue with police officers

A Sri Lankan Buddhist monk and villagers clash with police officers during a protest outside the inauguration ceremony of an industrial zone in Mirijjawila village in Ambalantota, Sri Lanka, Saturday, Jan. 7, 2017
description: Sri Lankan police used water cannons to try to break up violent clashes Saturday between government supporters and villagers marching against what they say is a plan to take over private land for an industrial zone in which China will have a major stake. The government has signed a framework agreement for a 99-year lease of the Hambantota port with a company in which China will have 80-percent ownership. Officials also plan to set up the nearby industrial zone where Chinese companies will be invited to set up factories. (AP Photo/Eranga Jayawardena)

Operaciones de Anglo Gold Ashanti en el mundo
description: AngloGold Ashanti (con sede en Johannesburgo, Sudáfrica) es actualmente el tercer productor de oro del mundo. Sus 21 operaciones se encuentran distribuidas en 10 países : Argentina, Australia, Brasil, Ghana, Guinea, Malí, Namibia, Sudáfrica, Tanzania y los Estados Unidos de América. Asimismo la compañía se encuentra realizando tareas de exploración en el oeste de Australia, Colombia y la República Democrática del Congo y está involucrada en las asociaciones de exploración y joint ventures en Rusia, China y Filipinas. Fuente: http://www.cerrovanguardia.com.ar/institucional/historia-de-la-empresa/

name: Dixie Valley Toad
description: "A Dixie Valley toad sits atop grass in Dixie Valley, Nev., on April 6, 2009. The Dixie Valley toad is found only in Nevada and its entire population lives in a thermal spring-fed wetland in the remote Dixie Valley." (Matt Maples/Nevada Department of Wildlife via AP, File)

name: Dixie Valley/Paumu
description: A view of the mountains in Dixie Valley or Paumu in Paiute. A fence crosses the landscape, likely installed by government agencies. Tribal Secretary Margot Dyer "imagined the area as it once was, without fences" saying, "[Bureau of Land Management] has some places fenced off. The Navy has their area, but it used to be open and we’d go as a family. The trees out there, we’d sit down underneath and have our little picnic and then go home. That was our way of life. And it was a good life." [8] (Image: Tim Lenard/The Nevada Independent)

name: People of the surrouding villages took out a rally on 06 Sept 2013
description:
About 4000 people marched through Challakere on 06 Sept 2013 town demanding the Kavals be handed back to the people and the suspension of Aditya Amlan Biswas, I.A.S for falsifying documents._x000D_
_x000D_
Picture: Srikanth Kelahatti

name: People submitting their memorandum to the Tahsildar of Challakere
description:
The demands mentioned in the memorandum are as follows –_x000D_
_x000D_
 1. The state government should immediately suspend the earlier D.C, Shri Aditya Amlan Biswas for falsifying documents and illegally diverting the Kavals_x000D_
2. The state government should withdraw the falsified documents and take the Kavals back from the various agencies_x000D_
3. The Karnataka State Pollution Control Board must not give any environmental clearances to DRDO, BARC, ISRO etc under any circumstances_x000D_
4. The police must be directed to stop filing false cases against the shepherds who use the kavals_x000D_
5. The various agencies must not prevent the people from grazing their sheep, cattle and goats._x000D_
6. As is done every year, this year too, the government must open Gosahalas in the Kavals._x000D_
_x000D_
The Tahsildar promised to submit the memorandum to the Chief Minister through the D.C, Chitradurga. He also said that funds for setting up Goshalas were in the process of being sanctioned._x000D_
_x000D_
Picture: Srikanth Kelahatti

name: March under the slogan "Decent pay for hard work" (23 February 2022, Warsaw)
description: Farmers raised the need for systemic changes, including support for food producers, demanded to ensure the profitability of livestock farming and reduce the price of fertilizers. Earlier, police blocked the entrance to the city center of 200 tractors that were to take part in the demonstration / Source: Agrounia Facebook account.

name: Flower happening (mid-June 2022, Warsaw)
description: Farmers from Agrounia brought 6,000 pelargoniums to Warsaw in mid-June 2022. In the morning, they placed a cross several meters high in the very center of Piłsudski Square. It is a symbol that Polish gardening is on its knees and is dying. Producers (mainly Dutch) got along with stores operating in Poland, which began to refuse to sell Polish flowers to the Dutch / Fot. M. Kałaska

name: Blockade (19 January 2021, Stryków)
description: The protesters blocked the roundabout at the junction of the A1 and A2 motorways with tractors. They lit a fire in the middle of the roundabout, and they also brought coke ovens. The fire brigade appeared on the spot. Agrounia leader said: "We are closed with our production and sales. We have no one to sell to, monopolies take over the food trade"/ Source: Agrounia Facebook account.

name: Quick protest (13 December 2020, Warsaw)
description: Symbolically, on the anniversary of the introduction of martial law, Agrounia farmers drove up near the house of J. Kaczyński (the head of the ruling party), closely guarded by private security and police officers. A dead pig, potatoes, eggs, celery, and cabbage were thrown out of a truck / Source: Agrounia Facebook account.

Un grupo de defensores del agua del cantón Girón festejan los  resultados de la victoria del no en la consulta popular el lunes 25 de marzo del 2019. Fotos Xavier Caivinagua para EL COMERCIO.
Inicio del paro en Atalaya 15 de agosto 2018
Manifestacion en Plaza de la  Constitución
description:
Souce: http://www.elciudadano.cl/2014/05/09/105361/les-pidio-una-oportunidad-para-responder-y-no-volvio-mas/_x000D_
"La contaminación del agua, el aire y la tierra, provocada por los enclaves mineros y proyectos energéticos, tiene a la población viviendo bajo condiciones inapropiadas.  La mina a cielo abierto de Pascua-Lama (Minera Barrik Gold), La planta de Agrosuper en Freirina y la Central Termoeléctrica de Punta Alcalde (Endesa) son los tres proyectos que la comunidad pide revocar su RCA._x000D_
_x000D_
Al lugar asistieron diferentes organizaciones sociales de la Región Metropolitana,  para acompañar a los cerca de 30 pobladores que se presentaron frente a La Moneda, luego de haber enviado una carta que no recibió respuesta, el día 7 de abril. Dicha resolución  por parte de la presidenta Michelle Bachelet, quien tiene la facultad de tomar tal determinación, debió ser entregada a las comunidades el día 30 abril."

Workers Protests
description:
Protesting the alleged callousness of Essar Steel in fulfilling their demands, mainly on compensation, rehabilitation and employment opportunities, hundreds of villagers from Nuagada areas staged a demonstration in front of the company&’s main gate today. _x000D_
Sources said that the villagers charged that the company is busy only in its project works like laying pipe line between Keonjhar and Paradip for its six million tonne pellet plant without bothering for the displaced families.“The villagers of Handia and Nuagada are the worst affected by the pipe line laying work. However, despite all our pleadings, the company authorities have not yet taken any concrete steps to consider our case,” said a villager. _x000D_
The 360 families, which will be displaced, were assured to be rehabilitated at a rehabilitation colony; but, the villagers alleged that even the patch of land is yet to be identified for the colony.

name: Svalbard archipelago in Arctic Norway
description: Source: Natalie Thomas / Reuters File photo

Hi, I will respond to each point so that it is easier:_x000D_
1- I can write a section on the situation now but I don't know a lot because the collective did not respond and there is not much online._x000D_
2- I added as much as I could but the permit is not precise as they were searching for potential resources without knowing if they would find some._x000D_
3- It is my mistake, I understood it wrong (I thought it had to be "visible" if it was a certain if the project was adopted, not if it was currently happening)._x000D_
4- We don't know why it was stopped, it probably played a role but the government also changed in between and the results of the research could have been insufficient (we don't have access to the findings of the research)._x000D_
6- I will do, I did not know I had to add more sources if the ones had all the information._x000D_
Best, Clarisse

name: 26. Waste management in the Roma neighborhood in Tvarditsa, 22 May 2019
Waste management
description: Public authorities in Tvarditsa fails to insure effective waste management in the Roma neighborhood in Tvarditsa. Lack of garbage cans in public space and insuffisant garbage collection lead to the creation of dumps in the neighborhood's outskirts. The picture has been taken on 22 May 2019 during a field mission.

name: Garbage removal in the Roma neighborhood in Tvarditsa, 22 May 2019
description: People leave their garbage at the street due to the lack of garbage cans located in public areas aiming to facilitate garbage collection. Garbage left at the street  in direct contact with people and animals raises many issue related to health risks, especially for children.

name: High electricity pylons in the Roma neighborhood
description: High electricity pylons and cables are located at the streets in the Roma neighborhood without any specific measures for preventing accidents, except a sign and inscription on the pylon. The picture has been taken on 22 May 2019 during a field mission in Iztok neighborhood.

description: High voltage pylons surround the neighborhood and are located on a few meters of the houses; there is a small dump in the entrance of the settlement.

name: Dump in Tvarditsa, 22 May 2019
description: An unregulated dump is located in the entrance of the Romani settlement, close to houses and roads.

name: Sewage is discharged on the street, 22 May 2019
description: The Roma neighbourhood is not connected to the sewage removal system of the town. As consequence sewage is discharged directly on the street.

name: Streets in Iztok neighborhood in Tvarditsa, 22 May 2019
description: Sewage and garbage are discharged on the streets due to insuffisant garbage collection, lack of garbage cans in public space and sewage removal system.

name: Status of streets in the Roma neighborhood in Tvarditsa, 22 May 2019
description: The picture has been taken in Iztok neighborhood during a field mission.

name: Garbage removal in the Roma neighborhood in Tvarditsa, 22 May 2019
description: People leave their garbage at the street due to the lack of garbage cans located in public areas aiming to facilitate garbage collection. Garbage left at the street  in direct contact with people and animals raises many issue related to health risks, especially for children.

name: 21. Garbage overflow in the Roma neighbourhood in Tvarditsa
description: The picture has been taken in Iztok neighbourhood in Tvarditsa on 22 May 2019.

name: High electricity pylons in Iztok neighhood
description: High electricity pylons are located on a few meters from Romani houses. There are not any specific measures for preventing accidents or negative health impact  of the pylons.

name: High electricity pylons in the Roma neighborhood

name: The nuclear power plant in Żarnowiec (2020, August 1)
description: After the construction was halted, a large amount of specialized equipment was immediately rendered useless. Most of it, including two of the four reactor vessels, were scrapped. The third reactor vessel, along with various other equipment, was bought by a nuclear plant in Loviisa in Finland for training purposes. The fourth is located in a training facility for nuclear industry workers in Paks, Hungary / Author: Mzywial; Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 4.0 International license.

name: Żarnowiec nuclear power plant - unfinished nuclear plant construction site. Buildings with changing rooms (2008, August 10)
description: The local government which took over the buildings was unsuccessful in preventing the already constructed buildings from falling into disrepair. Several of them were looted and devastated. No action was taken to preserve the reactor building; it was flooded with water and is unsuitable for resuming construction / Author: Łukaszewski P.; licence: CC BY-SA 4.0

name: Graffiti of Handziuk
description:
Activists paint a sign "Who ordered the killing of Katya Gandziuk?" as they rally near the home of Interior Minister Arsen Avakov in Kyiv on Nov. 17, 2018, demanding that the murderers of the slain activist are found and prosecuted. Gandziuk died on Nov. 4, 2018 from the consequences of the acid attack. Authorities have been slow in investigating the murder, taking months to locate suspected organizers of the attack. Gandziuk's friends and family attribute in to the high-reaching connections of the suspected organizers._x000D_
Photo by Volodymyr Petro

name: Banner with the words 'The threat is man - not nature - not for the Turnicki National Park'
description: Inhabitants of mountain villages are afraid that they will lose their jobs after the creation of the Turnicki National Park / Photo: Wild Carpathians Initiative

name: Carpathian Forest
description: This forest is characterized by high densities and landscape connectivity, and a large part of it is close to natural / Photo: Wild Carpathians Initiative

name: Banner with the words 'Eco terrorists away. We want to live and work in peace '
description: Most of the local community lives off forest management and treats environmental activists as enemies / Photo: Wild Carpathians Initiative

name: Skid trails reducing the retention capacity of the Carpathian Forest
description: Skid trails, including recently built paved roads with drainage ditches, drastically accelerate the runoff of water from mountain slopes, preventing its retention in the soil. The result of this accelerated runoff is rapid flooding in the valleys of mountain streams and the lower parts of the catchment area, increasing the risk of flooding in riverside localities / Photo: Wild Carpathians Initiative

name: 'Bears' from Bieszczady Mountains take matters into their paws
description: People dressed as bears fight for one of the last safe places for this animal to live in Poland / Photo: Wild Carpathians Initiative

name: Hammock protest
description: In August 2020, parallel to the blockade of the headquarters of the Stuposiany Forest District, a hammock protest was conducted at the site of the planned logging / Photo: Wild Carpathians Initiative

name: 'Destruction of Wildlife' Monument in Warsaw
description: A cut tree with monumental dimensions - a symbol of the destruction of the Carpathian Forest - in the Youth Climate Strike camp in front of the Palace of Culture and Science in the center of Warsaw (September 2019) / Photo: Wild Carpathians Initiative

name: National protest
description: On September 29, 2020, a protest was swept across Poland under the slogan "We will not give the Bieszczady back to saws." 17 Polish cities, 17 seats of the State Forests, where letters with postulates were sent and hundreds of people who came to express their indignation at the destruction of the Carpathian Forest / Photo: Wild Carpathians Initiative

name: National protest
description: On September 29, 2020, in all places of the protest, those gathered brought symbolic postcards from the Bieszczady Mountains, showing the scale of damage caused by forest management in this area. The signatures collected on them are to be sent to the new Minister of the Environment as a commitment to take action on the Carpathian Forest / Photo: Wild Carpathians Initiative

name: blockade
description: In August 2020, the entrance to the headquarters Stuposiany Forest District was blocked, where activists from the Wild Carpathians Initiative fastened themselves to the barriers with metal pipes / Photo: Wild Carpathians Initiative

name: Tent camp
description: A several-month-long strike of the Wild Carpathians Initiative at the site of intensive deforestation in the planned Turnicki National Park (since 25 April, 2021) / Photo: Wild Carpathians Initiative

name: 'Skyblock'
description: Platforms suspended between trees, under which it is impossible to drive without breaking the rope at the site of the planned logging in the area of the planned Turnicki National Park / Photo: Wild Carpathians Initiative

name: Attack on activists
description: On May 21, 2021, there was an attack on the Wild Carpathians Initiative tent camp where the activists were blocking the felling of trees in the planned Turnicki National Park. One of the masked attackers had a baseball bat. A female activist was injured and a car was destroyed / Photo: Wild Carpathians Initiative

name: Transmedia Artwork "Faces of Coal Resistance" by the artivist David Solnit and photographer Brooke Anderson
description: transmedia piece at the Oakland City Hall done in 2016, that honored the anti-coal efforts. Other part of the piece was a nighttime projection of the photos on the City Hall itself.

name: "I am Lenie Rivas"

I am Lenie Rivas_x000D_
“They tried to bury us. They didn’t know we are seeds."_x000D_
_x000D_
#StopTheKillings_x000D_
_x000D_
Lenie Rivas was a farmer and was a member of Lumad organization Malahutayong Pakigbisog Alang sa Sumusunod (MAPASU), along with two companions (Willy and Angel) they were massacred by 3rd Special Batallion Forces in Lianga, Surigao del Sur while harvesting abaca last June 12, 2021.https://www.facebook.com/saveourschoolsnetwork/photos/5902335846505395

Killings of September 2015 Dionel Campos
description:
It was three in the morning, September 1, 2015. Everyone was supposed to be sleeping, but the Lumad in Lianga, Surigao were forced out of their beds to witness a nightmare coming true._x000D_
_x000D_
It was the Armed Forces of the Philippines along with several paramilitary men. The Lumad were brought to a nearby bastketball court, where Lumad leader and teacher Dionel Campos would be mercilessly executed. He was forced down and shot directly in his head, before the very eyes of his kin._x000D_
Philippine Collegian 2021_x000D_

Hunger strike at the Bureau of Energy, the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA)
description:
In the morning of 18 April 2013, a lawyer was convening a press meeting with around 50 local residents including 4 hunger strikers, advocating "EIA illegal, EIA ineffective, redo EIA"._x000D_
2013年4月18日，早上8：40約50名鄉親及4位接力絕食者（已272小時）在環保署前召開記者會，由林三加律師主張「環評違法、環評無效、重作環評」。_x000D_
Behind them is the label saying "hunger strike area-AntiCrazyWindmills, 272 hours" , the banner held by people was saying " We are against the 24 hours noise from wind turbines, the noise will affect 2 km, we do not want Wind Turbine Syndrome", the other banner laying on the floor said "We are against the windmills that are destroying our clean coastline, we have already lost the egret sanctuary, we don't want to lose the coastline anymore".

Protesting against the advancement of aquaculture in the marine area of Kalamos Island western Greece
description: Within the core of the  GR2220003 Inner Ionian Archipelago marine protected area are the Islands of Kalamos and Kastos. Their inhabitants protested strongly in 2013 following failed political attempts to waive the legal characterization  of their waters and some of their lands (including protected Mediterranean pine forest on land) as an area for the development of industrial aquaculture made possible by the 2011 ministerial decree. Here is a photo of that protest for the only aquaculture unit in their waters that exists. The areas close to this and inside the marine protected area have a very high density of fish farms with almost 30% of the total production of raw fish in Greece and in direct violation of several pieces of international legislation and treaties with respect to biodiversity conservation and human rights.

name: Mapa Chevron Venezuela
description:
En este útil mapa elaborado por El Libertario, podemos ver que se mencionan las afectaciones socioambientales y las comunidades y pueblos indígenas comprometidos en las participaciones de Chevron en occidente (Estado Zulia), en los proyectos gasíferos (Plataforma Deltana, Cardon III) y en la Faja Petrolífera del Orinoco. En este sentido, como referencia es un mapa valioso, resaltando además que estas iniciativas de mapeo alternativo en el país son más que inusuales._x000D_
No obstante, el mapa es muy impreciso. No da cuenta de si son daños actuales o potenciales (los proyectos gasíferos están en negociación, aunque en exploración ya haya daños iniciales); no se expresa la dimensión de la participación de Chevron en estos procesos, lo que deja a otros actores responsables fuera de escena (una lectura fuera de la complejidad del proceso); en algunos casos no queda claro si se trata de proyectos gasíferos o de refinación y mejoramiento (donde Chevron también participa); y no refleja las afectaciones producidas por la empresa en proyectos de minería de carbón, como lo fue en el municipio Mara, estado Zulia. Todo esto, como lo hemos mencionado, es un síntoma de la carencia de información rigurosa sobre estos impactos de las compañías.

name: Reasons to stop Etalin project, by Conservation India
Rohan Chakravarty, www.greenhumour.com
description: Funded by Jindal Power (which will be executing the Etalin Dam project in Dibang Valley, along with the State Hydropower Corporation of Arunachal Pradesh), the Wildlife Institute of India conducted a 4 month study (despite a multiple seasonal replicate study being mandated by the Forest Advisory Committee), and concluded with a green signal for the project. 24 wildlife scientists from across India who have worked in Dibang Valley, have peer-reviewed the study, pointing out major flaws in the study, and the very fact that the study was designed to look more like research for a mitigation plan rather than analyzing the impacts of the projects in the first place.

name: Vecinos denuncian contaminación latente en la bahía de Cienfuegos [15]
description:
hace 8 días_x000D_
_x000D_
 _x000D_
 _x000D_
La contaminación en la bahía es evidente. El más reciente derrame de 12.000 metros cúbicos de aguas oleosas registrado en la refinería Camilo Cienfuegos en mayo pasado, supuestamente “controlado” por las autoridades, sigue enlodando a las especies de la vida silvestre, así como a las personas que habitan la zona.

name: Tras derrame en Cienfuegos autoridades aseguran que debe mejorar “respuesta a peligros
description: El colapso parcial del sistema de tratamiento de la refinería Camilo Cienfuegos debido a las inundaciones provocadas por la tormenta Alberto la semana pasada, terminaron con el derrame de unos 12.000 metros cúbicos de aguas mezcladas con hidrocarburo a la bahía, un accidente cuyo impacto ambiental aún no ha sido precisado.

The Sakura Pumping Station
description: Water conducted from the Naka River with a pump installed in the basement is discharged to the Sakura River. It was built along the Sakura River in Kawada Town, Mito City, and in March 2001 all facility maintenance was completed, including the construction of a space building and the installation of pumps.

name: Water bloom
description: Water bloom on the lake surface

name: The Tone Water Supply Channel
description: The Tone Water Supply Channel (approx. 2.6km in length) connects the Tone River and Lake Kasumigaura, and is established in the ground about 20-30m in depth.  It is a joint facility with the Kasumigaura Development Project conducted by the Water Resources Development Corporation (now Japan Water Agency).

name: The Tone Water Channel
description: The Tone Water Channel takes water from the Tone River and release it to the Tone River.

name: The Kasumigaura Water Channel
description: The Kasumigaura Water Channel takes water from Lake Kasumigaura and release it to Lake Kasumigaura.

name: The Mito Tunnel
description: It is an underground tunnel from Naka Pumping Station in Mito City Watari Chisaki to Mito CIty Kawawada Town Chisaki in the Naka Water Supply Channel.  Water flows up to 15 m3 / s from the Naka River towards Lake Kasumigaura and up to 11 m3 / s from Lake Kasumigaura toward the Naka River.

name: The Ishioka Tunnel
description: It is an underground tunnel connecting 24.7 km from the Mito shaft in Mito City Kawada Town Chisaki to the Takahama Pumping Station in Ishioka City Mimura Kantaku Chisaki, of the Naka Water Supply Channel. Water flows up to 15 m3 / s from the Naka River towards Lake Kasumigaura and up to 11 m3 / s from Lake Kasumigaura toward the Naka River. Currently, the tunnel is being divided into six sections, and Takahama Airport-Yuri Shaft (Section 6) and Kamiinuma Shaft-Ibaraki Shaft (section 2) have been completed.

name: Meeting after the settlement
description: A meeting fishery cooperative union heads and lawyers after the settlement in Tokyo.

name: The Naka Pumping Stataion
description: Water from the Naka River is delivered to the Sakura River and Lake Kasumigaura, and water from Lake Kasumigaura is released to the Naka River through the Naka Water Channel.  In 2004, along the Naka River in Mito City Watari Town, the construction of the pumping station, the construction of the sedimentation basin and the installation of the water delivery pump were completed.

Informative Banner.
description:
Post at Asian Peoples' Movement on Debt and Development: "As 한국전력 KEPCO faces the National Assembly of South Korea this morning, we put the spotlight on its proposed Sual coal plant in Pangasinan, Philippines, which, if approved, will add to its list of dirty projects that undermine environmental laws of its host countries and the Paris Climate Agreement, and contradict South Korea's declaration of a climate emergency!_x000D_
Earlier this week, APMDD sent a letter to the South Korean parliament urging them to stop KEPCO’s Sual coal plant project. As a state-run company, KEPCO should help South Korea to meet its climate obligations. #TotalCoalExitNow!" 14th october 2020.

name: Street Poster: No to Kepco coal fired plant in Sual. Our lives matter.14th october 2020
description: Facebook Post in No to Korean KEPCO Sual Coal Plant. 14th october 2020

name: The existing Sual 1 power station
description: The existing Sual 1 power station has been operating in Sual, Pangasinan since 1999 and will be decommissioned in 2024. Image by TeaM Energy in news post [2] Mongabay.com

name: [9]Post on KEPCO's decision to not proceed with Sual. 16th october 2020
description:
Facebook post in Asian Peoples' Movement on Debt and Development. UPDATE ON KEPCO SUAL COAL PROJECT: 한국전력 KEPCO has announced its would not anymore proceed with the proposed Sual coal plant in Pangasinan, Philippines, as well as Thabametsi in South Africa._x000D_
While this is a welcome news especially for the people of Sual, we hope KEPCO would also backtrack on its earlier announcement to finance Vung Ang 2 in Vietnam, halt its financing of Jawa 9 & 10 in Indonesia, and to not use this development to transition to gas._x000D_
Read our joint press release on this development with_x000D_
Solutions for Our Climate - 기후솔루션 here: https://drive.google.com/.../1QktloWVsyUXFQtjlgs8.../view... #TotalCoalExitNow

description: One kilometre of motorway requires 30,000 tonnes of sand, according to the 2013 documentary Sand Wars by Denis Delestrac.Bedrock signals the bottom of Nthange River's riverbed. Without sand to slow it down, rivers can diverge and travel at incredibly fast speeds over the bedrock during the rainy season. Locals describe it as "like a tsunami", which erodes the land and can sweep away people and livestock.
